citations.narrative:
Record of Acquisition of Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS 7005) was not up to date to reflect all dogs in the kennel. Four
new dogs have been added to the facility and each has a file, but were not listed on the facility's APHIS 7005. Up to date
records on APHIS 7005 are required and can be important for animal husbandry tracking. Ensure to update APHIS 7005
to reflect which dogs are now in the facility.
***Correct by 6/24/2023.

In the 2nd smaller building, ammonia odors were stronger around the dogs. Windows were opened during inspection to
help with fresh air flow and improved the air quality. Ammonia odors can cause dogs to get sick. Ensure that fresh air flow
is in place at all times while meeting temperature requirements. More frequent cleaning of areas under enclosures can
also decrease ammonia odors. Maintain adequate fresh air flow in the area around the dogs to prevent excessive odors.
***Correct by 6/13/2023.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
In the medicine storage area inside the kennel, there is excessive dust and some mouse droppings on and under the
shelf. Rodent control is in place in the facility, so it is unknown how old the droppings are. Rodent droppings and dust can
contaminate the medications and could make dogs sick. Ensure to maintain storage areas free from rodent droppings and
excess dust.
***Correct by 6/20/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Record of Acquisition of Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS 7005) was not up to date to reflect all dogs in the kennel. Four 
new dogs have been added to the facility and each has a file, but were not listed on the facility's APHIS 7005. Up to date 
records on APHIS 7005 are required and can be important for animal husbandry tracking. Ensure to update APHIS 7005 
to reflect which dogs are now in the facility.  
***Correct by 6/24/2023. 
3.3(b) 
   
Sheltered housing facilities. 
In the 2nd smaller building, ammonia odors were stronger around the dogs. Windows were opened during inspection to 
help with fresh air flow and improved the air quality. Ammonia odors can cause dogs to get sick. Ensure that fresh air flow 
is in place at all times while meeting temperature requirements. More frequent cleaning of areas under enclosures can 
also decrease ammonia odors. Maintain adequate fresh air flow in the area around the dogs to prevent excessive odors. 
***Correct by 6/13/2023. 
3.11(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
In the medicine storage area inside the kennel, there is excessive dust and some mouse droppings on and under the 
shelf. Rodent control is in place in the facility, so it is unknown how old the droppings are. Rodent droppings and dust can 
contaminate the medications and could make dogs sick. Ensure to maintain storage areas free from rodent droppings and 
excess dust.  
***Correct by 6/20/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
